examples: The plans for the new development have raised angry protests from local residents.
His angry glance said it all.
A hungry man is an angry man after all.
My grandmother got angry when I accidentally spilled juice on the carpet.
My boss was so angry that I really got the rough edge of his tongue.
words.defineEn: feeling very annoyed or upset because of something that we do not like
words.defineVi: cảm thấy rất khó chịu hoặc khó chịu vì điều gì đó mà chúng tôi không thích

examples: As frightened as I am to die, I'm also curious to know what it's like beyond the veil.
The villagers are very frightened of his ghost.
Mr Edgar looked very frightened.
I was kind of frightened.
I was definitely frightened.
words.defineVi: cảm thấy sợ hãi hoặc lo lắng

examples: I'm hungry.
This dish will serve four hungry people.
A hungry man is an angry man after all.
Eva is so hungry that she can eat a horse.
I’m getting a bit hungry.
words.defineEn: needing or wanting something to eat
words.defineVi: cần hoặc muốn một cái gì đó để ăn

examples: I feel thirsty and need a sip of water.
As the rain poured, the thirsty plant absorbed water through its roots, nourishing its leaves and stems.
They were all thirsty so I gave them a drink.
Toto and I are thirsty.
'I'm thirsty.'
words.defineVi: muốn hoặc cần một thức uống

examples: People will also simply get bored.
I was bored.
I was bored.
- I'm bored.
I'm bored.
words.defineEn: tired and unhappy because there is nothing to do or because we are no longer interested in something
words.defineVi: mệt mỏi và không vui vì không có gì để làm hoặc vì chúng ta không còn hứng thú với điều gì đó

examples: I'm happy to get a little more bang for my bucks.
As they say, a happy heart is better than a full purse.
Since she moved to a smaller apartment, my mother is as happy as a flea in a doghouse!
With his new job and his new car, Andy is a happy camper.
After their break-up, she was happy to see the back of her ex-boyfriend.
Oh yeah, that was sad.
That's pretty sad if you ask me.
Sad, woe is us, to come to this plight!
She would cry at the drop of a hat when watching sad movies.
It would be humorous if it weren't so sad the way Sarah tiptoes around her wife.
I'm tired of your playing fast and loose with me.
People will get tired of listening to him!
We're tired of hearing it!
I'm tired of working in this thankless IT support job.
I got tired of starting from square one again, man.
words.defineEn: needing to sleep or rest because of not having any more energy
words.defineVi: cần ngủ hoặc nghỉ ngơi vì không còn năng lượng

examples: He feels the cold a lot.
The film caught a cold over the outstanding debt.
Sarah’s got a cold.
On the day of the wedding, Brown experienced cold feet.
He's out cold and as still as a stone.
words.defineEn: having a temperature lower than the human body's average temperature
words.defineVi: có nhiệt độ thấp hơn nhiệt độ trung bình của cơ thể con người

examples: The weather was disagreeably hot.
The news came hot on the heels of another plane crash.
The factory closure follows hot on the heels of several others
The winter issue is hot off the press.
That hot guy had a good head on his shoulders.
words.defineEn: having a high temperature or a high degree of heat
words.defineVi: có nhiệt độ cao hoặc nhiệt độ cao

examples: Spending time with her family always does Emily the world of good, especially when she's feeling stressed or overwhelmed.
Tim was feeling stressed and overwhelmed, which caused him to be off his food and lose interest in eating.
When I'm feeling stressed or overwhelmed, I try to remember that patience is a plaster for all sores, and that taking a step back and giving myself time can help to alleviate my anxiety.
By the end of the study, the chocolate eaters are less stressed than their chocolate-free counterparts.
Like, these results could happen because, say, more stressed people turn to their phones for relief.
words.defineEn: feeling so anxious that makes one unable to relax
words.defineVi: cảm thấy lo lắng đến mức khiến người ta không thể thư giãn

examples: Police are worried that many crimes go unreported.
I'm not worried about my finances.
She was worried she was stuck in a dead-end job.
I'm worried that I didn't give a good account of myself in that job interview today.
I’m not worried about stepping on anybody’s toes.
words.defineEn: feeling unhappy and afraid because of something that has happened or might happen
words.defineVi: cảm thấy không vui và sợ hãi vì điều gì đó đã xảy ra hoặc có thể xảy ra
